# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(input::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input)
    wrapped_string = words[1]
    current_length = length(words[1])
    for i in 2:length(words)
        if current_length + length(words[i]) > text_width
            wrapped_string *= "\n" * words[i]
            current_length = length(words[i])
        else
            wrapped_string *= " " * words[i]
            current_length += 1 + length(words[i])
        end
    end
    return wrapped_string
end
```

Example:
```julia
wrap_string("This is a test of the wrap_string function in Julia", 15)
```
